column3: Back

I stayed home because I was feeling sick.
We’re late because the train was delayed.
I didn’t call because my phone died.
She smiled because she won the prize.
I’m smiling because it’s Friday.

Since it’s raining, let’s stay in.
Since you’re here, help me carry this.
Since nobody else volunteered, I’ll do it.
Since we have time, let’s grab coffee.
Since everyone agrees, let’s start.

As I forgot my wallet, he paid.
As it was late, we took a taxi.
As she was tired, she went to bed early.
As the shop was closed, I came back empty-handed.
As I had nothing to do, I watched a movie.

The reason why I’m late is the traffic.
The reason why she left early is a headache.
The reason why I chose this is the price.
The reason why he failed is no revision.
The reason why we won is teamwork.

I studied all night – that’s why I’m tired.
It rained heavily – that’s why we stayed inside.
He shouted – that’s why she cried.
I saved money – that’s why I can travel.
We practised – that’s why we won.

The match was cancelled due to rain.
Flight delayed due to fog.
School closed due to snow.
Event postponed due to illness.
Train late due to signal failure.

Owing to bad weather, we stayed home.
Owing to high demand, tickets sold out.
Owing to injury, he missed the game.
Owing to technical problems, the site is down.
Owing to lack of sleep, I’m exhausted.

Thanks to your help, we finished early.
Thanks to the rain, the garden looks great.
Thanks to practice, I passed the test.
Thanks to luck, I found my keys.
Thanks to her advice, I got the job.

Cancelled on account of illness.
Delayed on account of traffic.
Closed on account of renovations.
Postponed on account of bad weather.
Excused on account of a family emergency.

The main reason is lack of time.
The main reason is the cost.
The main reason is poor planning.
The main reason is bad communication.
The main reason is simply laziness.

It’s because I left my keys inside.
It’s because nobody told me.
It’s because the battery died.
It’s because I overslept.
It’s because I trust you.

What happened was the car broke down.
What happened was I forgot my passport.
What happened was she changed her mind.
What happened was the shop ran out.
What happened was the alarm didn’t ring.

I didn’t revise, as a result I failed.
It rained, as a result we got soaked.
He lied, as a result nobody trusts him.
She helped, as a result we finished early.
Prices rose, as a result sales dropped.
He missed the train

It’s too expensive, therefore I won’t buy it.
We’re tired, therefore let’s stop.
She’s allergic, therefore no cats.
Time is short, therefore hurry up.
Nobody came, therefore we cancelled.

It was late, so I took a taxi.
I was hungry, so I made a sandwich.
Nobody answered, so I left.
It started raining, so we went inside.
He apologised, so I forgave him.

That’s how I learned to cook.
That’s how we met.
That’s how I broke my phone.
That’s how the rumour started.
That’s how I ended up in Canada.

He never studies, which explains why he fails.
She smiles a lot, which explains why everyone likes her.
Prices are high, which explains why sales are low.
It rained, which explains why the pitch is wet.
I’m quiet today, which explains why I seem off.

Poor planning leading to chaos.
Lack of sleep leading to mistakes.
Heavy rain leading to floods.
Good reviews leading to more customers.
Arguments leading to a breakup.

This led to a huge argument.
This led to losing the contract.
This led to everyone leaving early.
This led to a complete disaster.
This led to finding a better solution.

Higher sales increased profits, which in turn created jobs.
Stress affected sleep, which in turn affected work.
Good weather brought crowds, which in turn boosted sales.
One mistake caused panic, which in turn caused more errors.
Kindness inspired others, which in turn spread happiness.

We kept trying and eventually succeeded.
After hours of walking, we eventually found the hotel.
She ignored the warnings and eventually regretted it.
Prices kept rising and eventually became unaffordable.
He saved for years and eventually bought the car.

Ultimately, the decision is yours.
Ultimately, health matters more than money.
Ultimately, we all want to be happy.
Ultimately, hard work paid off.
Ultimately, it was a huge success.

For this reason, I won’t be coming.
For this reason, we chose the cheaper option.
For this reason, the event is cancelled.
For this reason, phones are banned here.
For this reason, I always double-check.

I lost my passport. Because of that, I missed my flight.
He lied. Because of that, nobody trusts him now.
It rained. Because of that, the match was cancelled.
She helped me. Because of that, I passed.
They were late. Because of that, we started without them.
